itemDescription: British consul in Bucharest and writer

wikipedia_page.main: William Wilkinson (died 1836) was British Consul to the principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia, appointed to Bucharest by the Levant Company in 1813; he was recalled in 1816. He wrote a book An Account of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia: With Various Political Observations Relating to Them (1820). It was one of the books on which Bram Stoker took notes before writing Dracula, and the Romanian name Dracula was taken from it.Wilkinson was later posted to Syros, in 1829, by the Levant Company. He died in Paris on 23 August 1836.
